website_summaries.verdict: An affordable pool brush with a variety of design features that make it a good value.
pros: This solidly built pool brush is 18 inches long and features tough nylon bristles and a resilient metal backing
The curved ends make it easier to clean corners without fear of damaging your pool and it fits all standard poles
cons: The angle of the pole and the bristles can make it a little tough to keep pressure against the wall of your pool

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until bristles started breaking off
customer_reviews.text: Brush worked great for about three weeks, but then bristles started breaking off and I would find them floating all around my pool. They can't be good for filters/pumps etc. Not sure if I had an anomaly or if this is a common problem with this brush.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fall off after a year
customer_reviews.text: After only a year, this brush is no longer usable because it drops a ton of bristles into the pool. My previous cheapie all plastic brush lasted 3 years under the same care and was replaced only because the plastic parts broke (the bristles never fell off).
customer_reviews.author: Tom Thumb

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving design....brush is not straight across
customer_reviews.text: Photos of this brush are deceiving. The photos make it look like the brush is straight across and curves up at the ends. However, the brush curves in, in the middle. So when you brush a flat wall, the only part of the brush making contact is a small part on each side. You can clearly see the gap in the photo. You have to brush an area several times in order to clean it. Very disappointed. Had I know there would be a big gap in the middle of the brush, I never would have bought it. It's useless really, unless you just like scrubbing areas over and over. Poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: POOR design - worked well for about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: POOR design - worked well for about 2 months. Then, as reported by other users, the bristles breaking off . We bought two. I rotated the one that I had kept as a backup and had the same issue. At 8 months, bristles broke off in clumps. I am asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Adam

customer_reviews.title: How the heck is this Amazon's Choice? it's weak.
customer_reviews.text: Only good for wide flat surfaces, but I'm just grinding the plastic on tight radiuses (yes, I've used better brushes that can handle this). Also, not enough rows of bristles and there's not enough upward curve on the ends. Again, grinding plastic. I should have spent more for something more capable. Notice how the product description photos don't show the side profile of the brush? They're trying to hide it, folks.
customer_reviews.author: ememen

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: I left mine in the sun, you know- outside where the pool is(!) and I grabbed it one day, I dunked it right in the pole to use it and all these white things surfaced. Turns out it was the small brush bristles! It must have dried up from being outside ( where it’s supposed to be) and created a loose pack on the bristle holes- hundreds if not thousands of small pieces of nylon in my pool- it was so fun to clean up after the fact let me tell you!
customer_reviews.author: JOHNNA

customer_reviews.title: Right Out of the Box It was Fine
customer_reviews.text: I'll start by giving this a 5 * * * * * rating because it works just fine, being brand new. Over the years I've had three other different brand 18" brushes all of which began to shed bristles within a couple (2) years. This time I'm going to rinse the head with clear water after each use and store it out of direct sunlight. I just finished brushing some stabilizer granules from the bottom of my pool and when rinsing off the brush, a lot of a milky white residue washed away. Plus, I think the long term effects of chlorine might hasten the loss of bristles' I will update this review from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Karmesh

customer_reviews.title: Bristles Break off and end up in your pool
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 4 months, used maybe a handful of times. Started brushing the pool this morning and suddenly noticed a ton of white nylon bristles floating in the pool. Pulled the brush out and about half of the bristles had broken off while lightly brushing. I'm not even mad about having to throw away a $13 brush, I'm pissed that these bristles were being sucked into my filter as I frantically try to net them out. Save your money and a headache, buy a higher quality brush.
customer_reviews.author: ASUengineer

customer_reviews.title: Brushes falling out..!
customer_reviews.text: Seems after 1 month of use the brushes are falling out, not sure why, not sure I would buy again, my last brush lasted 10 years, this might not last 10 weeks!. replaced after one year, not really very good brushes fall out and clog filter, better quality required, would NOT recommend
customer_reviews.author: USAbooksstores

customer_reviews.title: A good value but has a limited life span when compared to higher priced brushes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these same wall brushes in the summer of 2016 and it lasted until the summer of 2018. There are brushes that I have had that lasted for four seasons but they are three times as expensive. For the price point of these brushes I feel that two years of use is pretty good. I would give them 5 stars but by the beginning of the second season they are already starting to wear down.
customer_reviews.author: Parrotheadjoe

customer_reviews.title: Brush fibers falling out in about 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The brush was decent and pretty typical like most. I used it to brush my pool about 4 times and stored it on a shelf outside, out of the weather. Now about 3 months since purchasing, the brush fibers are falling out. I'm finding white brush fibers in my pool filter and if I brush my hand against the brush, they are falling out. I've had a pool for 30 years and these brushes usually last 4-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: F1Guy

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for a few months
customer_reviews.text: Brush worked good for a few months then bristles all started falling out, I first noticed them in the skimmer and pump basket. There were more and more each time and there are parts of the brush that have all fallen out. Also if you have curved corners the brush doesn't curve enough to reach the corners good. Used for a few months when bristles started falling out. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Losing Bristles Half Way Through the Season
customer_reviews.text: Only half a season and this thing is shedding bristles like a scared porcupine. Good stiffness on the bristles, good shape, easy to use, scrubs well, sturdy enough in that it hasn't broken away from my extender pole or anything. But my goodness, there will be no bristles left by the time we close the pool for the season.
customer_reviews.author: MADMongoose

customer_reviews.title: Same as everyone...bristles falling out after a year
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a pool in a new home we purchased. Worked great for the first season. Now 10 months later the bristles are falling out like crazy (actually a few broke off and stabbed my skin when I brushed against it trying to clear the loose ones). Unless you plan on buying a new one each year then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall B

customer_reviews.title: You will get a good year out of it at least
customer_reviews.text: I have had this brush for well over a year now. Living in Florida it is used all the time, at this point it can’t be used any more due to the bristles falling off and into the pool. If you plan on replacing once a year , you will be fine.I am sure if I would have rinsed the chlorine off after each use it would have lasted longer, but that wasn’t going to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Fred D

customer_reviews.title: As others have mentioned, The bristles starting falling off within a couple months.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brush to occasionally brush the steps of a 13,000 gallon pebble pool. As with any similar brush, it did the job for a short while but I noticed bristles falling off shortly as my solar surface skimmer started revealing them in the catch basket. I didn't think much of it and though it might be be a few bristles here and there but it got progressively worse. The bristle seem to come off uniformly which makes me conclude that they are made from bad quality material or I got a bad brush. Very disappointed, occasionally brushing of pool steps and the brush is now unusable after about year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: This brush has flimsy bristles and the white retention pins don’t have nearly enough tension. With moderate force brushing the time falls off the pole to the bottom of the pool. I even tried bending the pole inward above the holes and it still fell out. I tried to return the item but amazon states it is not returnable. I am awaiting the sellers solution.
customer_reviews.author: The Truth May Hurt

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: After a year and a half, it looks like it's time to buy another brush. Won't be this brand/model. The bristles are coming loose, found a couple handfuls in the DE filter this weekend when cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Patriot

customer_reviews.title: I hate when companies offload their rejects to unsuspecting customers
customer_reviews.text: junk! Clearly defective. Had to remove excess plastic from bristles. plastic tabs do not line up with the holes so it won't stay on a pole. I hate when companies offload their rejects to unsuspecting customers.
customer_reviews.author: Gas-N-Steering

customer_reviews.title: Very strong design. Wish it had side brushes for corners.
customer_reviews.text: Very strong design. I just hope the bristles hold up better than my previous brushes. I so wish there was a small section of bristles on the ends to get into corners. Seems no one sells a perfect brush but this one is certainly made to last with the strong metal attachment of the brush to the pole.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce BTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the lifespan of this brush. I use it occasionally, maybe once a week during pool season. For some reason the bristles became so brittle and fragile that simply moving the brush across the pool cover resulted in all the bristles breaking off or falling out. I’ll toss this one and look for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Malm

customer_reviews.title: didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of pool season last year and used it a few times this year. Just brushed down my pool and have a bunch of bristles floating ... very sad because I thought this one was supposed to last "several years" and I didn't even get 1 year
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After less than 5 uses, bristles breaking off
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had paid closer attention to the other reviews, after less than 5 uses, bristles are breaking off in the pool. Yes it's inexpensive, but still should have lasted longer than 5 uses. Back to the pool store for the more expensive one that at least lasts a year.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Works ok if used as a hand brush but doubt if the cheap plastic will hold up long with pole use due to undersized neck requires constant pressure just to keep it attached. Could have paid a couple more bucks and got the good one at Walmart but was fooled by photo which makes it look like aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: A great commodity buy - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The brush quality and frame is strong and the bristles are firm. I find this to a very good, functional brush and a good value at around $12. A great commodity buy - Highly Recommended If you find this review useful, please let Amazon and me know by clicking the helpful button below! John J. Hogan
customer_reviews.author: johnjhogan

customer_reviews.title: Basic, but it just works
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and works well. The only thing I don't love about it is the plastic on the sides extends a bit far past the bristles so when I'm on the steps I grind into the hard plastic and scrape before I can ever get the corners clean.
customer_reviews.author: DAZEDandCONFUSED

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: This brush is a few months old, it's housed under cover out of the sun and has barely been used and it's falling apart. Bristles are breaking off into the pool and I have to scoop them out so they don't get stuck in the system. This was a waste of money as a pool brush should last longer. The brushes I've had in the past lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: The clear plastic bristle is not going to last like the last one I bought before
customer_reviews.text: For few dollars more you could get one from a local pool supply that has a stiffer bristle. The clear plastic bristle is not going to last like the last one I bought before. I will need to keep it indoors from the sun and really rinse it off after use. Next time...I'll Pay a little more for better quality brush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not crazy about it
customer_reviews.text: This brush has a couple of clips to hold the brush to the pole. They do not hold the brush securely. When brushing around the steps of the pool the brush falls of the pole. The steps with the numerous right angles requires a lot of manipulation to clean. The brush clips are weak and give way and the brush falls off the pole. I am going to bolt the brush on with a bolt and a wing nut. At the end of the year it will be replaced with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Hazguy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, not much fine print...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this thinking I could get to cleaning the pool right away and found that the brush head ships separately. So be prepared to buy multiple parts from different brands. Luckily I was able to find a pole to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Calen VanNess

customer_reviews.title: ... my wall brush every year and this one is better than most that I've tried
customer_reviews.text: I have to replace my wall brush every year and this one is better than most that I've tried. Bristles longer than most and nice and thick. Fit my existing pole with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Great pool brush with metal connection
customer_reviews.text: Solid built brush for the pool. Does the job in brushing the algae and stuff off of the pool sides and steps. Metal head that connects to the pole which is nice since my last plastic one broke requiring to buy this new one. Bristles are solid and don't seem to fall off like another brush either. Highly recommend, worked all summer and I'd say should last for a few more to come for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good price and much better quality than the similar priced ones at some discount stores. I love it. Will reorder if I need another one. Never will buy from any other source again. I've gone through several and I think this one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Gail H. Batson

customer_reviews.title: Loose bristles
customer_reviews.text: Bristles come loose and clog up the filter. I hose the brush down after use and try to keep stored in the shade, but the lifespan of this brush is very short. I'll spend extra in order to avoid the hassle of constantly removing the filter grids.
customer_reviews.author: Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful brush!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this brush! We have had ao many in the past that lost bristles each time you use it and this one doesn't. It's also a good size so it takes a lot less time brushing rhe bottom of our pool and the sides. I didn't have to use my vacuum as much either because the brush helpwd bring everything up to the surface for my filter to catch it. I also had no problem hooking it on the current poll we had. I would recommend this brush greatly!
customer_reviews.author: Diana P

customer_reviews.title: Bristles all fell out after one use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this brush once because have a pool service. Went to use it for 2nd time today and all the bristles started falling out everywhere! All over my pool deck and in pool. So now I have more of a mess. Dont buy
customer_reviews.author: Joia

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a season - bristles break off
customer_reviews.text: As many others are saying, the bristles break off soon after you start using it. I bought two of these, 11 months apart. The first lasted a summer, the second less than a full summer. I attached a pic where you can see how it's falling apart. Find one that's more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Deep_Diver

customer_reviews.title: Just over a year and no bristles left
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a year and went out today to find that all the bristles had broken off. They were all brittle and broke when I used the brush. This is just over a year old and I would have expected it to last much longer. My last one lasted years.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Zugore

customer_reviews.title: Bristles fall out.
customer_reviews.text: I got this brush June 2 2018. At the end of the 2019 season the bristles started to fall out. This year the were coming out so bad that they were getting stuck in the skimmer basket. Some may have gone through to the filter. I stopped using it. I sent an email to the manufacture, but did not get a response. BAD PRODUCT! BAD COMPANY.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Herrema

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I love this brush. I have a vinyl pool under ground 35 feet long and the deepest part is 8 feet. Brushes excellent. I don't give it 5 stars just because it could be a little bit heavier to make the brushing easier on the center and also the deepest part of the pool. Other than that...very pleased. I've had it for about 7 months now and no signs of deterioration.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bristles are falling out after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Bristles are falling out after a few months. It's solid and stiff but i find the little white nylon bristles in my skimmer basket constantly. No good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great brush at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these brushes for about 4 years now. They last a little over a year and then it's time for a new one. For $10 that is a good deal. It's a really nice brush.
customer_reviews.author: Pokermon

customer_reviews.title: High quality, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for over 2 years and the bristles are starting to wear down and break off especially at the ends. I think that two years is great, I'm ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bovard

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BOTHER BUYING THIS BRUSH!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BOTHER BUYING THIS POOL BRUSH! Tried it on a little dirt on the side of my pool and it missed more than half of if. Sending it back, unless you want to work 10×'s harder cleaning then stay away from this poor quality brush!
customer_reviews.author: DARLENE

customer_reviews.title: bristles fall out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May and it's Sept. used it today and all the bristles started falling out all over the pool. Made a huge mess and had to throw it away. Would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Audie Burns

customer_reviews.title: Weak Bristles
customer_reviews.text: Within the first six months and minimal use, the bristles began breaking off and /or falling off.
customer_reviews.author: mrogge

customer_reviews.title: Bristles falling out
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Nov 2017. Bristles are falling out and floating all over the pool. Less than a year old. Should last longer. Now I need to buy another. Plus it clogs up my filters. Not Happy.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item exactly a month and a half ago and the bristles have already started breaking off and floating around out pool. This item is very low quality. I could see this happening after a year or more of use, but 45 days? NO!
customer_reviews.author: Buy it @

customer_reviews.title: Bristles stated falling out in two months
customer_reviews.text: I kept the broom outside in the shade under a chair and it lasted two months. Bristles fall out by the hundreds.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money waiting for this. Buy one from Walmart or Home Depot. This one will start losing bristles after only a few uses, and you'll have to clean them out of your filter.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Started losing bristles
customer_reviews.text: The brush worked well at first, hence the three stars. However, now it is losing bristles regularly and making a surface plastic mess as it cleans the pool of other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Store out of sun, lasts several years still no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Two and a half years later in this brush is still working perfect. keep your brush out of the sun when you're not using it and it will last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I liked it when I first got it
customer_reviews.text: I liked it when I first got it. I don't use it very often.. Now bristles are falling out. Grrr
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money, bristles fall apart
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this brush, the bristles fell out on the first use and filled my pool with hundreds of them. I thought it was a good deal based on reviews and decent price, although it was not even the cheapest, but in terms of quality it is trash which is where it ended up.
customer_reviews.author: Murat2525

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Only lasted six months
customer_reviews.text: This is absolute junk. It only lasted just over six months. The bristle came off in the pool starting in the forth month.
customer_reviews.author: Florida waterskier

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality. The bristles fell off and blocked my vacuum machine
customer_reviews.text: The brush quality is poor. the bristles started to break off after 2 months and some off them were in the pool and blocked my pool vacuum machine(Polaris 360). I had to spend a whole afternoon to clean the vacuum machine and the pipe. You should stay away from this product if you have a swimming pool vacuum machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Works like I expected...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this type brush previously. The bristles on that one got brittle and fell/broke off. We will see if they improved it any. It still works well for what I bought it for, brushing pool walls.
customer_reviews.author: wyleone

customer_reviews.title: Started shedding bristles after one year.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year. Had to buy a new one, because I could see the bristles floating around after cleaning the pool/spa and they were clogging my DE filter. Trying the brush that Amazon recommends and is the #1 seller.
customer_reviews.author: K. Nishida

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and will not last . Pure Garbage in quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5 months and now is falling apart ! Pure garbage and not worth the money . Never would I recommend this low quality brush . It is filling my pool with the plastic tines and nearly useless . Avoid this ..
customer_reviews.author: Dollar

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this less than zero I could. It falls apart immediately. Small plastic bristles floating on pool surface. Epic disappointment. Complete trash.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good combo & great fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I been using this brush to brush my pool with the, HydroTools by Swimline Adjustable Blue Anodized Step-Up Telescopic Pool Pole. Good combo & great fits perfectly. The brush is well made, good quality, & durable.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie K

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: This one is a replacement for the last brush we had for only one season and the bristles all fell out. This one has worked well this season but the true test will be if it's in one piece next year. We don't use chlorine and store it in a garage so that's not the problem.
customer_reviews.author: L. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Pool Brush
customer_reviews.text: Have used in the past however the durability is not as good as it should be. Need to make sure the brush is kept inside to avoid deterioration by the sun.
customer_reviews.author: David Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Clean pool very nicely
customer_reviews.text: This brush cleans the pool very nicely. It scrubs gently on the walls. and has lasted me.
customer_reviews.author: lionel

customer_reviews.title: Nice brush for the pool...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brush to open the pool so I took a chance on this one. Glad I took a chance on this one. Sturdy and works great.
customer_reviews.author: mass

customer_reviews.title: Nice Brush. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly to clean algae from my pool walls. Much easier than using a rag.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: No quick release
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t stay tight on the pole. It disconnect after few scrubbing. It won’t snug fit to a standard pole. No quick release and insert like the other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Avid

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Pool Brush
customer_reviews.text: Nearly identical to brush I had been using for many years. Study connection and brush body. Bristles appear sturdy. Very happy with the product I received. Should be very durable for home pool use.
customer_reviews.author: Ksea

customer_reviews.title: Good 👍
customer_reviews.text: Does what its suppose to with no issues. Cost less than at the pool store. 🤟
customer_reviews.author: SeanTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Better then the broom attachment originally bought from pool store
customer_reviews.author: Philip zangara

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brush in September, 2019 and we already need to replace it. Our pool is tiny - 12x20 so there isn't a lot of scrubbing necessary to maintain it.
customer_reviews.author: Nonarunner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy metal handle
customer_reviews.text: This one has a metal handle where as many others are plastic. Wide strokes for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Whittingham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This brush is better than the original I have. It is impressively built, lighter and brooms the pool more efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Cardinell

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: We only had it for 2 years, keeping in mind that we don't need to clean the pool very much during winter months.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool Brush
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Works great. Very sturdy. Super price for item. Makes scrubbing sides and bottom of pool easy.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last. The metal stem where the pole attaches snapped off after a few months. For 12 bucks, I guess that's not bad. I'll probably try a different model next time.
customer_reviews.author: DRod

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered in August and the bristles started falling off in October. How is this product “designed to last for years” when it could last two months...Garbage
customer_reviews.author: William C.

customer_reviews.title: And now the pool is clean again
customer_reviews.text: Just what you expect. Fast delivery. Fits pole securely. Bristles appear to be solid in place.
customer_reviews.author: ffej

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't come with a pole, glad I had one to fit.
customer_reviews.text: The brush is great! I'm using it in a saltwater set up. Some things aren't durable in saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hefner

customer_reviews.title: brush
customer_reviews.text: works good but dont leave it out in the sun the brisells will start to come out had a few of these in my time
customer_reviews.author: Ernest A. Schepp

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the vinyl pool liner.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for sweeping down the pool. Gets into edges easily and has a nice wide sweep, getting the job done quickly. My only tip would be to store it OUT OF THE SUN. It will last a lot longer.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and works very well. I didn't realize how worn my old brush really was until I used this one. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: artsymom234

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: Fast ship. Great price. Quality equal to locally purchased but much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: DanC

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: The bristles started falling out of this brush within the first few weeks of use. I have had the previous brush for over 3 years without this issue, in fact, I'm back to using it, just had to replace the plastic attachment to the pole. I do not recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Bristles started falling out after 4th use in about 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bristles floating all over pool after only 4 weeks. Not sure why this is an Amazon's Choice... I had to throw it away and buy a new different pool brush.
customer_reviews.author: Phantom2120

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: Great pool brush been using it on my intex pool works great
customer_reviews.author: rud65

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasts a year
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this 14 months ago. This tool is always stored dry and out of sun. Brush can no longer be used because the bristles have become brittle, their breakage leaves too much debris.
customer_reviews.author: nlayton

customer_reviews.title: Bristles do not fall apart
customer_reviews.text: Use this brush at least once a week along the walls of my pool, have not noticed any bristles coming loose or breaking. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: afulke

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bristles have stayed intact this season. I like the reinforced top as well. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: I’m a pool professional
customer_reviews.text: This head sucks, when you go to cleaned the bottom curve of the pool it will scrape the top of the head because the angle sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one and received it minus the clips that keep it on the pole. Notified Amazon and had a replacement the next day. Works great, nice price. Pool looks very good with use of the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Bristles Come Out First Time
customer_reviews.text: DOn't waste your money. The bristles come out even on the first use. Then you have to clean the bristles out of the pool.
customer_reviews.author: JimSim

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fact that this brush has the metal piece on the plastic. I have had some of the other ones that have only been plastic, and they have been destroyed in a couple of months. This one has lasted at least 3 times longer than the other ones.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Midboe

customer_reviews.title: Good net
customer_reviews.text: As good as others that cost more money. Great for brushing walls and bottom of pool,
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace our worn out pool brush that only lasted one year. This brush is good so far. Time will tell if it lasts longer than a years worth of use in our saltwater pool.
customer_reviews.author: Jill S.

customer_reviews.title: Useless Piece of Crap
customer_reviews.text: Within in the first year of use, all the bristles became brittle and started fallin off. Second year, they are almost all gone. STF, dont buy this POS.
customer_reviews.author: Stanton B. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: I noticed algae starting to form at the bottom of my pool so I snapped this brush on to the pole and scrubbed for maybe five minutes, set my filter on for 12 hours and the pool is crystal clear again.
customer_reviews.author: Tarama Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for above ground pool after my other brush left the bristles floating on top of water. This has not degraded!
customer_reviews.author: NthTxMom

customer_reviews.title: Did not last a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Did not last a couple months. Bristles were coming out almost right away. After a couple months were coming out my the hand full. Threw out and bought a stainless steel bristled one. Hopefully this will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy - Did not last a year with very little use.
customer_reviews.text: The nylon bristles come out of the head. Wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

product_meta.title: Blue Devil Pool Wall Brush Deluxe with Poly Bristles - 18"
product_meta.description: Cleaning your pool can be tough, but the Blue Devil Wall Brush Deluxe makes it easy! Designed with poly bristles, this wall brush is strong enough to sweep your pool walls and flexible enough to get it done fast. Simply attach the brush to your telepole and you're ready to get your pool sparkling clean! Measures 18" for a wide sweep area.
feature_bullets: STRONG: Metal backing provides enough strength to thoroughly clean pool walls
FLEXIBLE: Designed with poly bristles to help reach the toughest corners
DURABLE: Crafted to last for several years of quality use
EASY TO USE: Simply connect to any telepole or pole and get brushing right away
WIDE SWEEP AREA: Measuring 18" wide, the Blue Devil Wall Brush Deluxe provides a large sweep area for quicker cleaning

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,168 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
